page.title: 02Daily Life
page.content: Local children get up in the week at about 7.30a.m. Their breakfast is usually cereal and a drink. They are at school from 8.50a.m. to 3.15p.m., where they have assembly, maths, language, games and P.E., art and craft, music, science, environmental studies and topic work and watch occasional educational television programmes. In the morning they have 15 minutes playtime, and at lunch-time 75 minutes. About half the children have school lunch and the rest have packed lunch. After school they watch television for about an hour. After tea they often play outside in the summer for about 2 hours. In winter they watch more television. Bed-time is usually 9.30p.m..
